RESUMO-CV.TEXTO-RESUMO-CV-RH: Cursei trs disciplinas isolada no Instituto Tecnolgico de Aeronutica (ITA), no ano de 2016. Disciplinas: CE-240 Banco de Dados, CE-245 Tecnologias da Informao e CE-230 Qualidade, Confiabilidade e Segurana (Safety) de Software. Possui Ps Graduao Lato Sensu em Redes de Computadores pela ESAB (2013), graduao em Licenciatura Plena em Informtica pelo Instituto Dottori de Ensino Superior - Faculdade Dottori (2013) e graduao em Redes de Computadores pela Faculdade de Tecnologia de So Jos dos Campos (2011). Atualmente docente da Faculdade de Tecnologia de So Jos dos Campos Prof. Jessen Vidal, Escola Tcnica Estadual de Estado de So Paulo, Etec Cnego Jos Bento e Etec de So Jos dos Campos, do Centro Estadual de Educao Tecnolgica Paula Souza. Coordenador de Projetos Laboratrio e manuteno de computadores. Tem experincia na rea de Cincia da Computao, Fui coordenador de curso tcnico em Redes de Computadores, da Etec Cnego Jos Bento, durante 3 anos e Coordenador do curso tcnico integrado ao ensino mdio de informtica (2018).
RESUMO-CV.TEXTO-RESUMO-CV-RH-EN: graduation at Licenciatura Plena em Informtica from Instituto Dottori de Ensino Superior - Faculdade Dottori (2013) and graduation at Redes de Computadores from Faculdade de Tecnologia de So Jos dos Campos (2011). Has experience in Computer Science, focusing on Computer Systems

DADOS-BASICOS-DO-CAPITULO.TITULO-DO-CAPITULO-DO-LIVRO: Value Engineering and Agile for building Urgent and Emergency Care
DADOS-BASICOS-DO-CAPITULO.TITULO-DO-CAPITULO-DO-LIVRO-INGLES: Value Engineering and Agile for building Urgent and Emergency Care

DETALHAMENTO-DO-CAPITULO.TITULO-DO-LIVRO: Value Engineering and Agile for building Urgent and Emergency Care

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS-INGLES: In health care, combating waste is an emerging issue as clinicians face the complexities of current patient care requiring to apply new technologies as also collaborate with professionals from engineering and computer science background. Answering to that call, during the 1st Semester of 2018, at the Brazilian Aeronautics Institute of Technology (Instituto Tecnolgico de Aeronautica - ITA), a successful Collaborative Interdisciplinary Problem-Based Learning (Co-IPBL) experience took place, for conceptualizing, modeling, developing, and testing a Computer System based upon Big Data, Blockchain Hyperledger, Micro-services, and other emerging technologies applied to Urgent and Emergency Care. The Co-IPBL experience had the participation of a medical technical team from the Hospital of Clinics at the Faculty of Medicine of the University of So Paulo. In the present article, we discuss how value engineering, agile and the business model canvas could help improve functionality benefit, reduce cost, combat waste and reduce complexity. We then propose a process to apply a quantitative method to prioritize valuable User Stories, reducing scope and demonstrating real delivered value as proposed in the Business Model Canvas. For the implementation, the Blockchain Hyperledger was used as a common database of health care information that doctors and providers could access.
